reviews.sentence: You will not be disappointed one bit. We were greeted by the Valet who was SO helpful we had never been here so he went beyond his job to help us. The concierge was busy but smiled the whole time taking care of everyones needs. The room its self was just super room 1532 the king bed was incredibly soft the view was great and we just loved the shower. Clean and modern we loved itPart of Circle City it is close to everything. Great dining drinks in the city but high prices everywhere. Be prepared to open your wallet there is also a pool hot tub on the main floor but we did not use it.

Business Spring Break Trip. We visited April 7 11 just after the Final Four event. I was attending a convention while the family took in some of the downtown activities over spring break. It was accessible to the convention center through the sky walk. We had two of the Capitol View Rooms which were very nice clean with views of the Capitol. The beds were comfortable. Hotel has a modern feel or design. When we did eat in the hotel the food in the hotel with room service and the restaurant were excellent. Service from all staff was helpful and pleasant. The fitness center has weight and cardio machines not much free weights. The indoor pool is small and a little cool. I would stay again when in Indy.
LocationHot tub out of order. Pool and pool room were freezing. Staff were unapologetic. Short on keys so we only got one per room.

Dirty. Room was so dirty toenail clippings on floor told the front desk. got oh sorry beds inn a double were so small 350 to park jacuzi. could not find the switch to turn it on valae guys were great.

NO SAUNA NO STEAMROM. Sauna is getting only 60 ° C after 1 hour the steam room is a shower with plastic chair inside we changed also room because of noise of airco unit outside on the roof of our room outside. the fitness is next to the pool area so chloride smell is every where and a lot.

Would stay here again anytime. Beautiful hotel omg the beds were so comfortable. Parking is steep at 2434 daily. Heated pool was chilly but bare able. The hot tub jets were not working. One South restaurant breakfast was the pits as was the server but other than that We had a great stay and staff was always warm and helpful. And did I mention the beds. ah maze balls.

Good. The staff was nice and provided items that we needed promptlythe parking was expensive. When we checked in no one told us that the parking was 25 each time you parked. Also the pool closed at 100 pm. We thought it should be open later.

Moldy showers and dirty rooms. My girlfriend and I stayed at the Hyat regency of Indianapolis over the weekend and I was not impressed. At check in the lady who helped us check in was not paying attention to us and did not even give us any information about our stay. Like how to get to our room or how much we were being charged for the deposit. When we arrived to the room we noticed old food crusted onto the comforter and mold in the shower. The housekeeper changed the comforter after we called and she was nice. There was also barely any water pressure when trying to shower or wash our hands. After exploring the city we came back to the hotel only to notice the doors were locked. It had a sign stating they had be locked after 10 pm but it was only 8. We then had to walk around to the other enterance walking in the street because there was construction blocking the sidewalk. We went to the pool and security was standing by the locker room door and the lady was very rude to us. We did not feel welcome at this hotel. There was a wedding going on as well there so you had to wait forever for an elevator only to be packed everytime. At check out I told the lady the problems we had and she did not offer us anything for our problems. To say the least we will not be staying at this hotel ever again.

I have not received pool facing room as in booking. I stayed there for 22 days. We have not got the room as per our booking. Our booking was showing pool view room. Also we lost 1 of our camera there in Hotel room so our experience with Hyat was not so good. Ambience was good There is 1 mall adjusent to hotel.

Weird night lights Pay for parking. But good value. The weird lights on either side of the beds kept turning on at random times during the night. A pillow over each took care of that. It also was not clearly explained that parking was extra. But overall a good value. my daughter loved the pool and hot tub.
ViewIt was greatGreat pool and location.

Perfect Location. The hotel is the perfect location for any visit to downtown Indy. Gorgeous views of the capitol building and close proximity to restaurants and entertainment. Although the room rate was a good value the parking rates were higher than expected. Kids enjoyed the pool area and adults made use of the exercise facility. I would consider staying here again.

I Love this hotel. We always have a great time here. It is clean safe and a great place to stay. Right in the heart of downtown convenient to shops restaurants movie theater mall. The kids really enjoyed the pool as well.

Hyat in Downtown Indy. The hotel was Convenient to the convention center and mall with walkways in case of bad weather. The hotel pool and exercise room on first floor. Staff was pleasant attentive. The food was not skimpy as in some hotels. The 18th floor lounge was well stocked whenever I visited and there was always an attendant to help or answer questions.

Very friendly helpful staff. I stayed here for a conference last week. Since I joined Hyat Rewards I was upgraded to a corner room which was huge and had a nice sofa king bed. The bed and linens were very comfortable. The bathroom had two vanities one with a sink the other with coffee maker and fridge but I could also use it for putting on my make up and doing my hair. That was nice since my husband was traveling with me. Huge shower with luxury soaps. The fitness center was adequate with treadmills and 2 elipticals facing the windows. Indoor pool and jacuzi. but we did not have time to use them. there is a Starbucks in the property hallway to the mall Subway and a fast food pizza restaurant also the Red Rooster which is open for breakfast and lunch. The Hyat is in very close walking distance to many very good restaurants. Even in the cold weather the eateries were so close to walk to the cold did not bother us. I would stay here again.
The hotel staff was friendly informative and efficient. The hotel was clean. The pool fitness center was also clean. Breakfast was delicious.

Hyat is never a let down. This Hyat Regency is more than expected. From the inside designed water falls to glass elevators breakfast buffet included omelettes and waffle bar fruit and arrangement of breads and bagels. The immaculate staff was just amazing. Heated pool is cool and if possible ask for the capital view side. The parking is pretty much a city joke problem so I very much liking that everything was within walking or Uber distance. Very well worth the money. Try to also use your Hyat ap to book to the additional promo code to save money. Very much worth the value.

Nice Place GREAT location. Nothing to complain about. if there is anything to point out it would be the pool facilities could use some updating other than that service was very strong. Location was fantastic room was well prepared. right by everything. nice having a Starbucks in lobby. Overall pool facilities. something about the stainless steel ledges hot tub could be updated.

Daycation. My family and I traveled to Indianapolis for an overnight daycation to go to the childrens museum and a couple of other things. We stayed at the Hyat Regency because of the indoor pool close proximity to the museums and positive reviews. I made the right choice. The room was clean and comfortable with a nice view of the city. My son enjoyed swimming in the pool. I had a great drink at the hotel bar while my son and husband played at the mall. It really was a great time. I travel a lot for work and if I needed to stay downtown Indy I would happily return.

I like the location to the stadium but I was sad that the pool was not open. We brought our suits but were told we had to go to another hotel if we wanted to swim. No one informed us prior to the trip. I get it some things need to be updated or fixed but you had think they would not do that during the Big10 championship. Then I was frustrated that there was no hot water from the bathroom sink for my whole stay. Maintenance even came and looked at it but it was never fixed. It was really inconvenient to have to use the tub spout to wash my face each night.
